metadata.title: CVE-2016-1283 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The pcre_compile2 function in pcre_compile.c in PCRE 8.38 mishandles the/((?:F?+(?:^(?(R)a+\"){99}-))(?J)(?'R'(?'R'<((?'RR'(?'R'\){97)?J)?J)(?'R'(?'R'\){99|(:(?|(?'R')(\k'R')|((?'R')))H'R'R)(H'R))))))/pattern and related patterns with named subgroups, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted regular expression, asdemonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp object encountered by Konqueror.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1').
